intro: Prostanthera discolor, commonly known as the variable mintbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Prostanthera discolor is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in coastal and inland regions across Australia.
